data.title: Who will play Gov. Tim Walz on Saturday Night Live?
data.meta_description: As Saturday Night Live returns executive producer Lorne Michaels will need to decide who will play Gov. Walz on the sketch-comedy show.
data.text:
It's official.

Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is joining Vice President Kamala Harris on the Democratic ticket in the 2024 presidential election.

After President Joe Biden announced he would not seek reelection, speculation started on who would fill the VEEP role. Names such as Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro, Arizona Sen. Mark Kelly, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker and Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear were all mentioned as possible contenders.

In the coming weeks, politicos will debate the choice heading into the Democratic National Convention later this month.

But others may be wondering who will play Walz on Saturday Night Live.

Who will play Donald Trump on SNL?

Nashville comedian and impressionist James Austin Johnson will likely reprise his role as Republican candidate President Donald Trump. He joined the cast in 2021 and received praise for his portrayal.

Who will play Kamala Harris on SNL?

Deadline reported that Maya Rudolph will return for the 2024 season to reprise her Harris impression. She debuted her impression in 2019 and made guest appearances in the lead-up to the 2020 presidential election.

She was a cast member from 2000 to 2007.

Who will play Tim Walz on SNL?

Lorne Michaels isn't afraid to bring in guest impressionists so the actor may not be on the current cast list.

Steve Martin

It's hard not to look at Walz and think Steve Martin would be the perfect doppelganger. Martin has hosted the show 16 times and made dozens of special guest appearances.

Darrell Hammond

Is there anyone Darrell Hammond couldn't impersonate? Hammond was a cast member from 1995 to 2009, has made several cameos and took over as announcer in 2014. Could Hammond go back in front of the live audience? Remember Hammond has impersonated everyone from President Bill Clinton to William Shatner from John McCain to Jimmy Carter.

Mikey Day

As for a current cast member, Mikey Day may be suited to take on the impression. He started as a writer in 2013 and was added as a featured player in 2016. He has a variety of impressions including Elon Musk, Roy Moore, and Donald Trump Jr. and has even impersonated Joe Biden.

Larry David

The viewers wanted the SNL writing alum to play Sen. Bernie Sanders and David delivered. He impersonated him from 2016 to 2020 and hosted once during that season.

What is an Impossible burger made of? : Here's a look at the vegetarian patty

'SNL' cast departures: Punkie Johnson, Molly Kearney exit

Someone else

The official 50th season cast list has not yet been released. A new addition may step into the role as well.

When is the next season of SNL?

The 50th season of SNL is scheduled for Sept. 28.
